messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: quotes - Emerson and Fitzgerald
messages.msgSnippet: Reminds of two favorites oft quoted by a journalist friend of mine: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind
messages.messageBody:
Reminds of two favorites oft quoted by a journalist friend of mine:

"The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two
opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to
function" -
F. Scott Fitzgerald

"A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds. . ." -
Ralph Waldo Emerson

danielle.conger@... writes:


> "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then. I contradict myself, for I am
> large and I contain multitudes." Walt Whitman
>



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
